item.title: Leaf clearance urgently needed in the green bexleyheath, 17th September
item.description:
This was logged around 3-4 weeks ago but at the wrong address it was logged at the green in welling not bexleyheath so this is not urgently as people are falling including an elderly lady on the wet slippery leaves. these leaves have been swept between18-20 the green and because of the amount the resident doesnt think this will be able to be cleared with the machine she thinks someone is going to have to bag these leaves up themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Ennerdale Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 274 Camden Road, 17th September
item.description:
Original ref number: 7123106 I had an email saying that this issue was fixed. The issue has not been fixed. This is a major drop in level on this bit of pavement. It need excavating and re-levelling. It is very dangerous. This is the third time I have reported this. This council seems to have money for everything except fixing the pavements! If someone gets injured, I will submit this evidence, that you have ignored my requests on three occasions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 215, Camden Road, Tufnell Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes, 17th September
item.description:
These bushes right next to Wickes are overgrown and men use this area to urinate. This is a daily issue no matter what time of day. You cannot walk on that side of the pavement. Wickes is claiming that it is not their responsibility. The whole area around the building is used as a dumping ground for all sorts of rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Minden Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more abandoned bins (5 now), 17th September
item.description:
Corner of Dunstan's Grove and Dunstan's Road. These were first reported in June 2025 when there were 4. There are now 5. They do not belong to any of the adjacent properties (or have been dumped by their owners) and are being filled with general rubbish by passers by. They are not needed or wanted and only encourage fly tipping. Please can there be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Dunstan's Grove, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
